qas.question: What is one of the most crucial virtues in today 's society ? Where is my hometown ?

answers.text: There is no denying that honesty is one of the most crucial virtues in today's society.   From my perspective, it means being accountable and being true to one's words. Once we commit ourselves to doing something, we should spare no effort to make it come true.   Nevertheless, we too often encounter some deceptive behaviors which really trigger annoyance and disturbance in our daily life.   For instance, some students risk cheating in exams for the privilege of scoring higher and being deemed as top players. Still, others may tell lies at the cost of credibility to reap temporary benefits. To better advocate the significance of honesty, people who conduct those misdeeds should be severely punished.  While under specific circumstances white lies may be acceptable, in most cases sheer honesty is the best policy. qas.question: What is developing very fast nowadays ?

paragraphs.context: On the one hand, science and technology brings fun and convenience to us. It's of great help in improving our living standards, including food, clothing, living conditions and traveling. It also brings convenience to our communications through mobile devices and the Internet, which help us exchange information more freely.  On the other hand, it does have some bad effects. For example, modern ways of communication reduce the chances of people getting together. Due to the development of technology, many jobs have been taken over by robots and modern machines leaving many people out of work. What's worse, because of the development of industry, environmental pollution has been caused and the balance of nature is broken.  In my opinion, we should treat science and technology properly and try to make good use of it for further development.

paragraphs.context: Casey couldn't wait for the train she was on to arrive at its destination.   Soon after her train arrived, they were leaving the harbour and sailing out into the sea.   However, an hour later, the engine suddenly stopped!   They could only just see the land, so Casey's aunt used the radio to call for help.  The helicopter took twenty minutes to arrive. A man came down on a rope and lifted Casey out of the boat, then went back for her aunt and uncle. She never thought she'd have a helicopter and a boat ride on the same day!

The book became the bestseller immediately after its publication in 2004, selling 50, 000 copies in two weeks. It was later translated into dozens of other languages and adapted into a film with the same name, directed by French director Jean-Jacques Annaud.
